figure.note: Pencil, pen and ink drawing with watercolour: two men
figure.label: Specimen of the clay figures.
CONTRABANDISTASmuggler
BEGGAR

div.ab: otra tal, que siempre les dexa: con la qual el autor de la hermosura excedió los limites de su perfecton, E ansi quando la dulce aurora de la mañana espira con el resplandor del sol, se demuestran perlas clarisimas que no se pueden significar. E con esto entre mi (id est) entre esta alcazar y la felicidad; hay notoria similitud, é la similitud emana de mi proprio ser.Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 15. G begins copying here mid-sentence, but his possible reference (+) does not lead to the first half of the published sentence anywhere in this notebook.another such, which always leaves them: with which the author of beauty exceeds the limits of his perfection, And so when the sweet dawn [AA has 'aura'] of morning exhales with the radiance of the sun, the clearest pearls appear that cannot be conveyed. And with this between me (that is) between this fortress and happiness; there is obvious similarity, and the similarity emanates from my own being.

“all is the work of the great Aben Hacere may god preserve his state among Kings.WG's translation from Spanish in Antigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 16. Antigüedades árabes has 'Naçere' rather than 'Hacere'.

Another “Glory to the most noble of all the ages expugnador de las ciudades nuestro señor Abu Abdallah gozo y contento de los NaseritasAntigüedades árabes, vol. 2, p. 16 (WG's partial translation of Spanish).Glory to the most noble of all the ages, conqueror of the cities, our Lord Abu Abdallah, joy and contentment of the Nasrids.. Above the Hermanas an aparttapartment. ascended by a stair on Rright In this chamber Solo dios es VencedorOnly God is victorious.. ornamented with leaves & flowers, & “The omnipotence of God”.
An Idea that this was the queens apartment, PaseosEcheverría, Paseos por Granada,
